title: Can you give me some music recommendations? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends. On Who you are, your background, education, how much you and what You read. Depends on your predominant mood and other things. Listen to anything You can including all reccommendations made here. When listening try to close your eyes and to check what is the first thing You feel. I still remember that moment almost 25 years ago when I listened Máster of Puppets of Metallica and Kiss Alive III by the first time. Something made “clic” and my life changed for ever. Just wanted more and more and many other rock and metal bands crossed my path. My personal soundtrack started to be created. I learnt that masterpieces are created by something beyond the control of the composer or band. Is a kind of pure energy flowing from tracks to speakers and altering enery at the place where is played. Those pieces are recorded by musicians on a state of mind where they don't want to impress anyone and are playing from hearth. Even if You don't understand lyrics for being in another languaje You Will feel the sincereness of that piece of music. For example, most of the religious music( Christian, gospel, gregorian Chants, japanese Zen sakuhachi, hindi Citar music, muslim Quoram's prayings,) have this ingredients. For me the wave of PinkFloyd and Enigma arrived like a tsunami. Also Slayer, Megadeth and most of the 80s hard rock bands, Deep Purple, The Doors and sychodelic bands from US West Coast in the 60s. Recently I listened more Electronic music from Ministry of Sound, HedKandi, and the compilations from Fabric Club in London. Travelling and listening to musicians at their born place is a very Rich experience. When listening Scorpions in Hamburg and Coldplay in London I felt true happiness on those musicians and their music. Just caused by playing at home. Good to know the place where music is made. That álbum Viva la Vida was strong Just after living a winter in England. Duran Duran songs had more impact when travelling by the London Underground. Cuban music and salsa got stronger when listened on Miami and when travelling to North Florida and radio stations started to play country music, the landscape changed completely. With time You Will change as a person and your tastes will also do. When You feel music as repetitive and You start to feel less impressed by something New on the generes You tipically listen to, have a radical change. 7 years ago I jumped into Electronic, and at same time started playing Mozart and argentinian tango intensively. Now I jumped into bossa nova, samba and Brasilian music from different regions. Also Colombian Caribbean music and more and more Flamenco. I Will never forget the Blues and classic rock but I felt I won't be able to listen same music every single Day and month. Uh? Reccomendations? The 3 songs on my personal list were made by argentinian band Soda Stereo. A mix of hedonist, dark and sweet notes made by Gustavo Cerati on a time when most of the rock coming from Argentina was full of rage and mellancolic sounds after the 1976-1983 dictatorship ended. Be open minded. World is full of musical jewels waiting to be discovered, tasted and enjoyed. Even out of the mainstream anglo-saxon music stablishment are comercial and less commercial music, sincere and full of good energy waiting for You to shake the ground you step!

Thanks for the A2A Ashlyn Melody Ember! Original Question: Can you give me some music recommendations? I’m looking for more music to listen to. I like Twenty One Pilots, Paramore, Panic! At the Disco, Fall Out Boy, Imagine Dragons, and Porter Robinson. Any suggestions would be nice. (That’s not all the music I listen to, but it’s all I could fit.) I’m happy to give you some music recommendations, but you probably won’t like them since I mostly listen to music in Japanese. Metal music. Trust me. It is totally worth it. As for the bands…Best for start,if you are new to Metal are just genresHeavy,Power,Symphonic, Folk, Progressive Metal and some Thrash. I will give a scale in “heaviness” for each genre out of 10 for these to tell,which one should be checked first. Where 10 is the heaviest of these. Note : The genre category is not 100% correct. Most bands are multiple genres. Used to simplify things. Heavy Metal - Black Sabbath, Led Zeppelin, Deep Purple, Iron Maiden, Judas Priest, DIO, Rainbow, Saxon, Motorhead.3/10 Power Metal - Rhapsody, Helloween, Stratovarius, Powerwolf, Blind Guardian, Hammerfall, Battle Beast, Beast in Black, Brothers of Metal, Gloryhammer, Twilight Force, Demons and Wizards(Hansi of BG with Jon Schaffer of Iced Earth), Iced Earth, Angra,Manowar,Grave Digger, Dark Moor, Sonata Arctica,Kamelot,Pathfinder,Cryonic Temple,Majesty... 2/10 Symphonic Metal - Nightwish, Sirenia, Therion, Xandria, Within Temptation2/10 Gothic Metal - Epica, Theatre of Tragedy, Tristania, After Forever. 4/10 Progressive Metal - Dream Theater, Symphony X, Opeth(New stuff), Ayreon, Star One, Tool, Animals as Leaders...3/10 Progressive “Death” Metal - Opeth(Old stuff), Gojira, Ne-Obliviscaris.8/10 Folk Metal - Eluveitie, Alestorm,Korpiklaani, Elvenking, Týr, Arkona, Turisas4/10 Blackened Folk- Ensiferum, Wintersun, Manegarm, Finntroll, Equilibrium, Skalmold, Bathory(Their 5th album +). 7/10 Thrash Metal - Megadeth, Metallica, Overkill, Exodus, Testament, Slayer, Anthrax, Annihilator... 5/10 Melodic Death - Amon Amarth, Arch Enemy, Aephanemer, Kalmah, Children of Bodom... 8/10 Atmospheric Black Metal - Ellende, Elderwind, Darkspace, Lustre, Saor, Eldamar.. 6/10 Symphonic Black Metal - Empreror, Dimmu Borgir, Cradle of Filth, Bal-Sagoth10/10

Been an indie fan my whole life…..BUT I also play classical violin…music has NO boundaries so don’t not listen to stuff you think is lame. Listen to- The BEST singer songwriters - Nick Drake/Jack Bruce(ONLY his first 3 solo albums)/James Taylor/Van Morrison Punk/Mod best - Sex Pistols/The Stranglers/The Jam When blues went electric and became rock-Jimi Hendrix/Cream/Early Black Sabbath Classical- Vivaldi - the four seasons SOUL - Ella Fitzgerald/Aretha Franklin/Marvin Gaye Early Alternative - Joy Division / The Smiths / The Cure / U2 /White Stripes Grunge - N.I.R.V.A.N.A. & Pearl Jam Britpop - Oasis/Blur The Rolling Stones & The Beatles Folk - you HAVE to listen to Bob Dylan well that’s enough for now….the more you listen the further back you’ll go ..to when it all started…. MUSIC IS FUCKING EXCITING

I grew up listening to R&R, R&B, and my father's C&W, and I dug them all. But the genre of music I would recommend the most is definitely CLASSICAL. Why? Because it is simply the best. And it is also the most diverse. From Gregorian chants, to madrigals, to motets, to Bach, to Beethoven, to Barber, all the way to modern minimalists like Adams, Glass, and Corigliano, there is simply MORE THERE. So what should you start with? Why, the Greatest Hits, of course. Bach's Brandenburg Concertos. Vivaldi's Four Seasons. Beethoven's Fifth and Ninth Symphonies. Anything by Chopin. Even Stravinsky's Rite of Spring, Barber's Adagio For Strings (which Oliver Stone used in his film Platoon), and the equally tear-jerking soundtrack for the documentary film The Fog of War by modern minimalist composer Philip Glass, if you're feeling adventurous. Then you can graduate to the more challenging modern nationalist composers like Grieg, Dvorak, Sibelius, and Rachmaninov (among many others!). If you come to appreciate this genre of music, I guarantee that you will also appreciate the best of what popular music has to offer. It certainly happened to me. Happy listening!

Hi, I don't really have many credentials, but I listen to a lot of music. If you're into bands like Panic! at the Disco and twenty one pilots, I would recommend some of the older artists that influenced them, like Depeche Mode, or maybe David Bowie. If you're more into the darker side of the artists you mentioned, I would recommend that you try listening to acts like Skinny Puppy or Nine Inch Nails. These are not for everyone, but they are at least worth a listen. If you are into the more alternative rock side, there are plenty of others that are fairly similar, such as Franz Ferdinand and MISSIO. I hope this helped!

I will not recommend the typical… Steve Earle Danny Gatton Marty Stuart Mary Chapin Carpenter Early Wishbone Ash Lone Justice Oingo Boingo Early Steeleye Span Gentle Giant Pentangle Lyle Lovett (and His Large Band) Allison Crause and Union Station There are many more out there that you do not know about. Go outside your comfort zone and listen to music you would never think to consider. You will surprise yourself at just what is out there beyond your horizon.

Consider exploring some of the soundtrack artists. There has been some really wonderful music created for motion pictures that became integral elements of a movies’ success, but hold up very well when appreciated apart from the film. John Williams, Jerry Goldsmith, Lalo Shifrin were some of the composers from the 70’s and 80’s that come to mind immediately. The soundtrack for “Papillon”, “The Empire Strikes Back” are notable listens. The original soundtrack by Vangelis for “Bladerunner” is amazing. A more contemporary artist of note is Yoko Kanno, who is truly a musical chameleon. Most of her work has been done for Anime , but well worth your time.

I have many artists I can recommend. It depends on who I am recommending them to (knowing their taste) and the purpose of the recommendation. If person asks me for a recommendation, I have to know what it's for. Is it for a wedding? A dance party? Or a quiet night in front of a campfire? Do they want something lively or quiet? Do they enjoy great lyrics or is the beat more important? Do they want do they want something with a pop sound or are they looking for something on the experimental side? If you were to let people know what the purpose of the music is and also what some of your favorite artists are, they can probably make better recommendations.

I gather from the bands you listed that you’re into the pop punk scene. If you lean heavy (closer to rock/metal), I highly recommend The Pretty Reckless, In This Moment, Five Finger Death Punch, Bring Me The Horizon, NF, New Years Day, Of Mice and Men, Palaye Royale. If you lean light, I’d recommend Ultraviolet, JoJo (recent stuff!), Jon Bellion, Mayday Parade, MISSIO, MGK (not recent stuff). Oh and I recommend blackbear to everyone - if you hunt through his music, you’re guaranteed to find something you’ll like.

I would suggest some artists: Linkin park. Beatles (start with songs like Yesterday and Hey Jude. Coldplay (One of the best. Listen to Scientist, yellow and viva la vida) Led Zeplin (listen to stairway to the heaven) Eminem (start with Lose yourself and Not afraid) Harry Styles (maybe his album is the best of 2017. Sign of the times is good listen) One direction (Don’t listen to their first 2 albums. Listen to their albums named four and Made in the AM. Almost all the songs are good in four.) Here are artists you should not listen to : Justin Bieber. (some of his songs are good but most of them are bad) Nicki Minaj (Listen to Anaconda and then you will know) DJ Snake and many other EDM artists. (its your choice)

Any music that brings you something you consider worthwhile is good music. Listen to what moves you. For me it’s rock and roll, and some classical. But everyone has their own tastes. If you are more specific as to what you like, people could recommend other things they hope you might like as well. If you’re not sure what you like, listen to everything you can find. I’m middle aged and i still find music i never heard before and wind up loving. There’s almost an infinity of choices. There’s something for everyone.

FlayHarvey DangerThe Black KeysI could go on, lol but I'm sure there will be other suggestions. Good luck, hope you discover some new tunes!

From Fall Out Boys and Paramore, you can explore their direct and indirect influences. Try out Black Flag and Sisters of Mercy. There was a cross pollination from 70–80s punk rock. This is where Goth, Punk, Thrash, and Emo derive from. Listen to this and see if anything happens.  If you wanna listen to some Psychedelic Rock, Blood Ceremony and Jess and the Ancient Ones are rad and those lead back to Mercyful Fate, Iron Maiden, Jethro Tull, and Black Sabbath. On the general rock n roll side, checkout The Hellacopters who are basically the Swedish MC5. One other band I highly recommend is Opeth. I don’t know your taste in the heavier side of thing but they acoustic tracks are majestic.  Basically if its Scandinavian, it must be worth listening: Abba, Europe, Bjork, Solstafir, Wardruna, In Flames, and more.

Listen to Superchunk! Majesty Shredding is one of my favorite records. And Smashing Pumpkins! Any of their records… Put Eagles of Death Metal during your next road trip or Death! or the Eagles! You know who else is good? (the) Melvins! They have 2 drummers! And they are both incredible. Speaking of drummers, listen to A Perfect Circle and Rush! Also, check Tool out. Really anything with Maynard James Keenan’s name on it is going to make you feel something. Music, man. It's the best
I run into your question by chance and would like to recommend some of my favorite songs, which are on repeat.

Try breaking out of your mould and listening to other genres of music. There are so many out there that one can easily become overwhelmed. Have you ever listened to Pink Floyd, Jethro Tull, Harry Chapin, Three Dog Night or Yanni? They may be old groups, now defunct, even, but they put together some brilliant stuff, each one different from all the others.

If you like Porter Robinson’s music, you’re bound to like the music of artists such as: Madeon, k?d, and Mako. The other bands you list are generally pop rock/alternative rock. For that genre, I would recommend One Republic, Of Monsters and Men, and Oh Wonder.

Instrumental music in my opinion is the best kind. Though there are so many genres of music, instrumental music is the best. It doesn't directly convey the meaning and let's you dwell on it, interpret it for yourself and gives each person a different emotion. It lets your mind wander, which in turn helps you relax as well as sort out soo many things going on in your mind. So personally I would recommend instrumental music of any kind

Sounds like you like My Chemical Romance, maybe try MUSE on for size, they are something incredible. Kaleo, new from Iceland. And if you are adventurous, Scott Dunbar, the One Man Band, in a Tinfoil hat. Cheers to your Ears!

What type of music do you like? There are many genres of music- rock, classical rock, Inde rock, Country, Metal, Big Band & Swing, Jazz and on and on and on! Here’s my advice. Download Pandora (its free) and start listening to music. It should t take you long to figure out what you like and what you don’t. I like pretty much everything- as long as it’s good. There is good music of all types and categories and crummy music in the same. And remember- what is “good” is a subjective thing. Thanks for asking!
